column4: hey guys
can u help me setup my pen-tablets
you should just need the "wacom-tools" package
ya i installed that
but there is no /dev/input/wacom
is this a tablet laptop or a usb kind?
its usb tablet.. with a Pen :)
lemme find you a wiki page
ok,
is it a wacom?
i dont know that, and i seached to find if it has the wacom chip... but googling says that most of them uses wacom chip
its a i-pen
well, it seems like there may be linux drivers
um, i already have installed xorg-wacom input driver, what more will i have to look for
hopefully, thats all you need. there's a common problem with /dev/wacom being not correct.
https://help.ubuntu.com/community/Wacom
ok, let me try some hacks :)) and i m sure, i will be back with messy system, as i do always
u know, how much stupid i am,,,,, i installed the driver,and searching for the /dev/input/wacom... which is maintained by udev,, and me stupid has not connected the tablet yet
i dont have that problem, my tablet is built into the monitor ;)
how long ago did you get that ipen?
2 years ago... , and was kept just, now i got some work to do with it
